metadata.Title: CVE-2019-13952 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - low.
metadata.Description:
The set_ipv6() function in zscan_rfc1035.rl in gdnsd before 2.4.3 and 3.x before 3.2.1 has a stack-based buffer overflow via a long and malformed IPv6 address in zone data.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-13952` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gdnsd - 3.8.0-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gdnsd package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.8.0-1').
